variable.name: geneva_id
variable.description: Unique identifier provided by GENEVA coordinating center (CC) for MEC subjects

variable.name: study_id
variable.description: Study identifier

variable.name: ethni
variable.description: Self reported race/ethnicity

variable.name: sex
variable.description: Gender

variable.name: status
variable.description: Case/control status
variable.comment: Case has prostate cancer diagnosis; control does not

variable.name: age_cat
variable.description: Age at entry into cohort (baseline) in 5 year intervals
variable.comment: Age at entry to cohort was used to match cases and controls

variable.name: agedx_cat
variable.description: Age at diagnosis for cancer cases

variable.name: ageco_cat
variable.description: Age at blood draw for controls

variable.name: bmi_cat
variable.description: Body mass index (BMI)

variable.name: fh_prca
variable.description: Family history of prostate cancer (brother or father) reported at baseline

variable.name: pa_cat
variable.description: Hours per day of moderate or vigorous physical activity, on average, during the past year reported at baseline
variable.comment: Categories are based on gender-specific, cohort-wide quintiles with the following cut-points: 0.32, 0.71, 1.07, 2.04

variable.name: packyrs_ca
variable.description: Pack years of smoking (cigarettes) reported at baseline
variable.comment: Pack-years is calculated as number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day times the number of years smoked

variable.name: ethanol_ca
variable.description: Alcohol (drinks per day) reported at baseline
variable.comment: This categorical variable is determined from grams per day of alcohol consumption (12 grams=1 drink)

variable.name: d_lyco_cat
variable.description: Density for lycopene intake (micrograms per 1000 kilocalories per day) reported at baseline
variable.comment: Categories are based on gender-specific, cohort-wide quintiles with the following cut-points: 752, 1077, 1437, 2023

variable.name: p_fat_cat
variable.description: Percent of calories from fat (%) reported at baseline
variable.comment: Categories are based on gender-specific, cohort-wide quintiles with the following cut-points: 24.1, 28.6, 32.3, 36.3

variable.name: d_calc_cat
variable.description: Density for calcium intake (milligrams per 1000 kilocalories per day) reported at baseline
variable.comment: Categories are based on gender-specific, cohort-wide quintiles with the following cut-points: 245, 304, 362, 439

variable.name: currsmoke
variable.description: Currently smoke? (reported at baseline)

variable.name: eversmoke
variable.description: Ever smoke? (reported at baseline)

variable.name: severity
variable.description: Aggressiveness of disease for prostate cancer cases only: calculated from SEER summary stage and differentiation variables (the latter provides an estimate of gleason grade)
variable.comment: SEER SUMMARY STAGE: 1=localized 2=regional by direct extension 3=regional by lymph nodes 4= regional (both 2 and 3) 5=regional NOS 7=distant metastases 8=not abstracted 9=unstaged or unknown SEER DIFFERENTIATION: 1=gleason grade 2,3,4 2=gleason grade 5,6,7 3=gleason grade 8,9,10 4=undifferentiated 9=unknown CODING FOR SEVERITY: 1) STAGE=1 and DIFF=1/2 2) STAGE=2-7 and DIFF=1-9 (or) STAGE=1 and DIFF=3/4 (or) STAGE=9 and DIFF=3/4

variable.name: dbgap_stat
variable.description: Provides information re submission of data to the NIH GWAS data repository (dbGaP).
variable.comment: For USC subjects entering the study using an informed consent prior to the 9/20/2000 version, the use must be restricted to studies involving cancer as the informed consent documents discussed only cancer. For USC subjects signing an informed consent dated 9/20/2000 or later, data may be used to study any chronic disease. For HI subjects, consent status allows Health Research and Methods.
